text: Bottled (MT/KS/MB February tasting). Amber colour with a small off-white, but well lasting head. Aroma is mild nutty notes with some toffee and mild wooden notes. Flavour is sweet malts, some nutty notes as well as some grassy and mild sweet wooden notes. Hiding the alcohol rather well, but does have kind of a Bock feeling to it. Sweet malty and ripe fruity finish.
Bottled , Cesky Brod , CZ , Malt,roasted,caramel,fruity and alcohol aroma , Clear amber color with smaller lacing head , Sweet taste with longer finish , Average carbon , SMedium body , Pretty good.

(draught) hazy deep golden-amber colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of bread dough and floral hops, with a hint of cherry stones, some dried apricots and powdered sugar. flavour is mostly chestnut honey and pale malts, with some notes of floral hops, yeast and a semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Nefiltrovany keg at Pivovarsky Klub 17/10/14
full bodied, bready, slightly sweet but balanced by herbal bitterness.
Bottled. An amber beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes bread, malt, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, malt, and bread, leading to a dry finish.
50 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is grassy, straw. Sweet, alcohol presence. Bitter and light sweet. Mild alcohol and toasted malty finish.

Bottle 0,50L. Clear, copper brown colour with large, creamy, off-white head. Aroma of grassy hops and hay, a touch of caramel, some spices and pepper. Flavor is medium bitter with a touch of alcohol and caramel. Finish is medium bitter, too.Medium body, oily texture and lively carbonation. Yep, monks are cool...

Bottle, 0.50l, courtesy of CanCrusher. Clear deep amber color, large creamy tan-like head, good lacing and soft visible carbonation in palate. Aroma of caaramel malt, nuts, mild alcohol, dark fruits and herbal hops. Taste starts with moderate sweet caramel and toasted malt, following is fresh grainy and fruity, while finish is pleasantly bitter. Medium body, thick texture and average carbonation in palate. Monks rock :)
Bottle, 500 ml, from Prague. Pours amber with small white head. Malty aroma, medium body. Sweetish malty with light bitterness in the end. Not bad at all.
Nose is a bit of marzipan, a bit of toffee. Head is nice and steady, tea color. Bitter finish, full body, some strange notes in the taste, not easy-drinkable, but OK. Bocky alcohol feeling.

Very creamy town beer with nice caramel and fruitiness from yeast. Full bodied good beer from when it is cold outside

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Klub malych pivovaru. Reddish amber colour. Medium sized head, medium duration, offwhite coloulr. Aroma light coffee, light grassy and hoppy, light roasted, though overall a bit light and undistinguishable.Taste a bit alcoholey, malty, barley, a bit sharp, A bit watery.
Pours dark amber with am off white head. Aroma is fruity, malty and bready. Flavor is fruity, sweet and well hopped. Finishes sweet and malty and bitter.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks Lee. Clear amber Metallic aroma with a bit of toast, light graininess and a bit of hoppy hints. Sweetish flavor with light toastiness and a drier finish with some bitterness, slightly hoppy. Light to medium-bodied.
Une belle mousse, joie couleur. Vague souvenir, donc a mettre à jour asap.

05.04.2012. 0.5l Bottle. Thanks to Gunnar!! A little hazy golden orange colour. White head. Aroma of strong malts with notes of sweetness and floral hops. Very rich flavours of malt. Very nice rich beer with malt sweetness. Very nice refreshing summer floral hops. Good beer
UPDATED: MAY 27, 2014 nuts, earthy, leather, smoke, vanilla, brown, sparkling, brown foam, medium sweetness, very bitter, medium sourness, salty, sticky, average carbonation, long finish

Pivovarsky Klub, Prága. Áttetsző, világosabb árnyalatú barnásvöröses színe, illetve közepes méretű piszkosfehér habja van. Illata malátás, karamellás, mogyorós és erősen aszalt gyümölcsös, valamint gyógyfüvesen komlós. Íze hasonló, nem túl édes, a komló is ki tud bontakozni, ám mégsem túl kiegyensúlyozott. Kissé olajos, de könnyedén iható és a szénsavassága is rendben van. Csehes újraértelmezése a baksöröknek, egyébként nem rossz.

Draugth at Prague Beer Museum, 15 cl. First of all I wonder if this beer really is a Bohemian Pilsener. At Prague Beer Museum it is sold as an Amber Lager, and the full tastes of caramell, christmas herbs and some cherry doesn´t make this a typical pilsener at all. Whatever, this is just a beatiful beer, with loads of aroma and taste.

draft at Zly Casy.  peppery toffee nose.  similar flavor but brash, harsh and rough malt throughout, especially across the middle with a small explosion of carbonation.  mild acidic plum, caramel and tobacco weirdness and just a little bit vinegar-like.

Bottle from Pivonka. Pretty decent,stronger beer with dry hoppy taste and palate.Earlier Rating: 12/23/2010 Total Score: 3.5pretty strong pale lager and pretty decent one. caramelish taste,nice palate, enjoyable.
Pale amber.  Nice bready aroma with some firm breadcrusty accents.  Firm breadcrusty malts.  Fairly smooth body, but with light alcohol notes late, as befits a bock.

looked like one of those peel-less marmalades (an abomination in my opinion - the marmalade, not the colour of the beer). The nose reminded me of various Christmasy type things, the sweetness of honey and a light spiciness of gingerbread, with just a subtle hint of vanilla. It was quite sweet, and a little syrupy, and I felt it could have done with a touch more bitterness. As the drink wore on, I am convinced I got a whiff of glue - not sure what was going on with that, but certainly it was there.

Bottle from Pivonka, Hradec Kralove. Pours clear amber with a huge white creamy head. Weak malty aroma. Taste is mellow and fresh, light roasted malts, light hopped, aftertaste is moderate sweet with no bitterness at all.
Good beer, if you are on the malty side of life that is.
Bottle at SMÖF 2010. It poured a clear golden liquid with a minimal white head. Flavour of malt, honey and sweet malt. Smooth mouthfeel and medium thick body. Malty and sweet pilsner.
Bottle at SMÖF 2010. Golden, small head. Malty fruity aroma with some alcohol. Malty profile in flavor, again with some alcohol.

Bottled at Söderbärke Mikroölfestival, Sweden.  Clear pale amber, small head. Honey aroma. Sweet with medium body and clean, rounded mouthfeel. Notes of grass and butter. Some alcohol in a finish with fairly low bitterness.

(Bottle 0,5l)
Floral, herbs, sweet malty aroma. Clear golden-amber color. Medium creamy white head. Medium sweet, alcohol flavour. Creamy soft medium-full body. Light bitter, warm alcohol finish.
tried at home as usual, very nice malty special, hoppy bitter aftertaste, nice maty aroma, nice balance, sour a bit though, very good after all, sorry about the

bottle from Pivní Galerie, labelled Svatecni lezak 17%. Amber colour, medium-size head. Well balanced hoppy and malty lager with hints of roasted malt, caramel and a pleasant amount of bitterness in the finish. A shy fruity sourness is also present.

Draught at Pivovarsky Klub, Prague.   Amber with a slight haze and a big, firm head.  Yeasty aroma with a slight acidity and some peach and strawberry.   Similar to their Granat, but with more bitterness to balance the fruitiness.   Nice hops combine with honey-nectar sweetness.   Medium body with a clean, bitter end and smooth carbonation.   Very nice beer.

bottled, from pivni galerie. opaque amber with a thin white head. aroma of wet metal railings and peach liqueur, some scary mango and paw paw alcohol flavours but mellows out with some decent grassy-metallic bitterness. ok for a european strong
